segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 42
segments.en: Linked Discourses 42

segments.pli: 1. Gāmaṇivagga
segments.en: 1. Chiefs

segments.pli: 2. Tālapuṭasutta
segments.en: 2. With Tāḷapuṭa

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.

segments.pli: Atha kho tālapuṭo naṭagāmaṇi yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho tālapuṭo naṭagāmaṇi bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Tāḷapuṭa the dancing master came up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “sutaṃ metaṃ, bhante, pubbakānaṃ ācariyapācariyānaṃ naṭānaṃ bhāsamānānaṃ:
segments.en: “Sir, I have heard that the dancers of the past who were teachers of teachers said:

segments.pli: ‘yo so naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe saccālikena janaṃ hāseti rameti, so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā pahāsānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjatī’ti.
segments.en: ‘Suppose a dancer entertains and amuses people on a stage or at a festival with truth and lies. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of laughing gods.’

segments.pli: Idha bhagavā kimāhā”ti?
segments.en: What does the Buddha say about this?”

segments.pli: “Alaṃ, gāmaṇi, tiṭṭhatetaṃ. Mā maṃ etaṃ pucchī”ti.
segments.en: “Enough, chief, let it be. Don’t ask me that.”

segments.pli: Dutiyampi kho tālapuṭo naṭagāmaṇi bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: For a second time …

segments.pli: “sutaṃ metaṃ, bhante, pubbakānaṃ ācariyapācariyānaṃ naṭānaṃ bhāsamānānaṃ:
‘yo so naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe saccālikena janaṃ hāseti rameti, so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā pahāsānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjatī’ti.
Idha bhagavā kimāhā”ti?
“Alaṃ, gāmaṇi, tiṭṭhatetaṃ. Mā maṃ etaṃ pucchī”ti.
Tatiyampi kho tālapuṭo naṭagāmaṇi bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: And for a third time Tāḷapuṭa said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “sutaṃ metaṃ, bhante, pubbakānaṃ ācariyapācariyānaṃ naṭānaṃ bhāsamānānaṃ:
segments.en: “Sir, I have heard that the dancers of the past who were teachers of teachers said:

segments.pli: ‘yo so naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe saccālikena janaṃ hāseti rameti, so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā pahāsānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjatī’ti.
segments.en: ‘Suppose a dancer entertains and amuses people on a stage or at a festival with truth and lies. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of laughing gods.’

segments.pli: Idha bhagavā kimāhā”ti?
segments.en: What does the Buddha say about this?”

segments.pli: “Addhā kho tyāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, na labhāmi:
segments.en: “Clearly, chief, I’m not getting through to you when I say:

segments.pli: ‘alaṃ, gāmaṇi, tiṭṭhatetaṃ,
segments.en: ‘Enough, chief, let it be.

segments.pli: mā maṃ etaṃ pucchī’ti.
segments.en: Don’t ask me that.’

segments.pli: Api ca tyāhaṃ byākarissāmi.
segments.en: Nevertheless, I will answer you.

segments.pli: Pubbe kho, gāmaṇi, sattā avītarāgā rāgabandhanabaddhā.
segments.en: When sentient beings are still not free of greed, and are still bound by greed,

segments.pli: Tesaṃ naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe ye dhammā rajanīyā te upasaṃharati bhiyyoso mattāya.
segments.en: a dancer in a stage or festival presents them with even more arousing things.

segments.pli: Pubbe kho, gāmaṇi, sattā avītadosā dosabandhanabaddhā.
segments.en: When sentient beings are still not free of hate, and are still bound by hate,

segments.pli: Tesaṃ naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe ye dhammā dosanīyā te upasaṃharati bhiyyoso mattāya.
segments.en: a dancer in a stage or festival presents them with even more hateful things.

segments.pli: Pubbe kho, gāmaṇi, sattā avītamohā mohabandhanabaddhā.
segments.en: When sentient beings are still not free of delusion, and are still bound by delusion,

segments.pli: Tesaṃ naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe ye dhammā mohanīyā te upasaṃharati bhiyyoso mattāya.
segments.en: a dancer in a stage or festival presents them with even more delusory things.

segments.pli: So attanā matto pamatto pare madetvā pamādetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā pahāso nāma nirayo tattha upapajjati.
segments.en: And so, being heedless and negligent themselves, they’ve encouraged others to be heedless and negligent. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the hell called ‘Laughter’.

segments.pli: Sace kho panassa evaṃdiṭṭhi hoti:
segments.en: But if you have such a view:

segments.pli: ‘yo so naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe saccālikena janaṃ hāseti rameti, so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā pahāsānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjatī’ti, sāssa hoti micchādiṭṭhi.
segments.en: ‘Suppose a dancer entertains and amuses people on a stage or at a festival with truth and lies. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of laughing gods.’ This is your wrong view.

segments.pli: Micchādiṭṭhikassa kho panāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, purisapuggalassa dvinnaṃ gatīnaṃ aññataraṃ gatiṃ vadāmi—
segments.en: An individual with wrong view is reborn in one of two places, I say:

segments.pli: nirayaṃ vā tiracchānayoniṃ vā”ti.
segments.en: hell or the animal realm.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, tālapuṭo naṭagāmaṇi parodi assūni pavattesi.
segments.en: When he said this, Tāḷapuṭa cried and burst out in tears.

segments.pli: “Etaṃ kho tyāhaṃ, gāmaṇi, nālatthaṃ:
segments.en: “This is what I didn’t get through to you when I said:

segments.pli: ‘alaṃ, gāmaṇi, tiṭṭhatetaṃ; mā maṃ etaṃ pucchī’”ti.
segments.en: ‘Enough, chief, let it be. Don’t ask me that.’”

segments.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhante, etaṃ rodāmi yaṃ maṃ bhagavā evamāha;
segments.en: “Sir, I’m not crying because of what the Buddha said.

segments.pli: api cāhaṃ, bhante, pubbakehi ācariyapācariyehi naṭehi dīgharattaṃ nikato vañcito paluddho:
segments.en: But sir, for a long time I’ve been cheated, tricked, and deceived by the dancers of the past who were teachers of teachers, who said:

segments.pli: ‘yo so naṭo raṅgamajjhe samajjamajjhe saccālikena janaṃ hāseti rameti so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā pahāsānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjatī’”ti.
segments.en: ‘Suppose a dancer entertains and amuses people on a stage or at a festival with truth and lies. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of laughing gods.’

segments.pli: “Abhikkantaṃ, bhante, abhikkantaṃ, bhante.
segments.en: Excellent, sir! Excellent!

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti; evamevaṃ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
segments.en: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there, the Buddha has made the teaching clear in many ways.

segments.pli: Esāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
segments.en: I go for refuge to the Buddha, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Labheyyāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyaṃ upasampadan”ti.
segments.en: Sir, may I receive the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence?”

segments.pli: Alattha kho tālapuṭo naṭagāmaṇi bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, alattha upasampadaṃ.
segments.en: And the dancing master Tāḷapuṭa received the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence.

segments.pli: Acirūpasampanno ca panāyasmā tālapuṭo … pe …
segments.en: Not long after his ordination, Venerable Tāḷapuṭa

segments.pli: arahataṃ ahosīti.
segments.en: became one of the perfected.

segments.pli: Dutiyaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha,…

suttaplex.blurb: Talapuṭa the head of a troupe of performers asks the Buddha whether the belief that performers have a good rebirth is correct. The Buddha tries to dissuade him, but ultimately reveals that by inciting lust they head to a bad rebirth. Talapuṭa is distressed and asks to ordain.
